name: ViperBar
author: ViperChill

sections.description:
ViperBar adds an attractive bar to your site header, which you can use to increase blog or newsletter subscribers. It includes built in styling, Aweber & Feedburner integration, conversion rate tracking, split-testing, themes, and much more.

ViperChill, a blog on Viral Marketing, is the creator of this plugin. If you want to take your blog to the next level, you should read this post on WordPress SEO.

Donations

You may make donations at http://www.viperchill.com
sections.installation:
1. Upload Viperbar directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Use the options page to make changes.
sections.faq:
How do I contact you?

Email hq@viperchill.com

Yes.
sections.changelog:
0.9

The initial version of the plugin is ready for the masses.

1.0

Visual Tweaks

1.1

Added MailChimp

1.2

Various bug fixes related to different website layouts and theme structures.
Fixed issues with incorrect stats displaying.
Fixed synchronized backgrounds.
Fixed bugs that were preventing the bar from displaying on some sites.

1.2.1

Fixed duplicated bars when wp_footer is called twice.
Added external version tagging for troubleshooting.

2.0

Added Sticky.
Added Themes.
3.2.1 Compatible.
Added Opacity/Transparency.
AJAX form submissions.
Custom thank-you page for Aweber.
Hex color options for appearance.
Added split-testing option.
Added submission data, including pages submitted on, and timestamp.
HTML support for custom content.

2.1

Minor upgrade, fixed a Firefox/Aweber bug.
